taskDescription:
Debate proposal: Is language learning enough for a true multilingualism?

Would two foreign languages plus one native language made us multilingual enough?

Reductionist foreign language learning policies limit multilingualism spirit, despite ‘strictly speaking’, language learning was established with the best of intentions to increase multilingualism.

[Debate whether you agree or not with these statements and why. Debate ideas in the group can be summarized in this essay task]

Some provocative thoughts to start with: 19th century was mostly monolingual, 20th century was mostly ‘English-centered’. Will 21st century be truly multilingual? Reducing foreign language learning to one or two languages is good for communication but not so good for multilingualism. What about the other 599 languages spoken in Europe?
